did.unittitle: Smythe and Wythe Counties, Virginia, Ledger, 1850, 1862-1865
did.abstract: Ledger started in Chatham Hill in Smyth County, Virginia, in 1850, discarded and then recommenced in 1862 in Rural Retreat, Virginia. Included in the entries are the labor records of a free black woman, and Washington Steptoe.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Smythe and Wythe Counties, Virginia, Ledger, Ms1988-029, Special Collections, University Libraries, Virginia Polytechnic Institute & State University, Blacksburg, Va.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: This ledger was started in Chatham Hill in Smyth County, Virginia, in 1850, discarded, and then re-started in 1862 in Rural Retreat, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The ledger includes entries of labor records of a free black woman, and Washington Steptoe.
